messages.subject: Re: was: enjoying my kids re:shows we don't agree with
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/10/2003 4:46:43 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Just curious what it is about this show that you don t like. Accalia, 4 1/2, likes to watch
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/10/2003 4:46:43 PM Eastern Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:
> The
> fairly oddparents really gets under my skin and that one we do not
> allow because I think he is too young.

Just curious what it is about this show that you don't like. Accalia, 4 1/2,
likes to watch this show from time to time, but it's not a big deal either
way.
I only saw one of these, and it was all about the boys and men being turned
into girls and women and thinking it was the most horrible thing that ever
happened. They never came to any conclusions that being female would be anything
less than horrible, and were finally changed back.

I was pretty horrified, and ranted for quite a while to the amusement of my
nephew, who was watching this with me. (Sean was pretty much oblivious to the
plot...the tv was on, but he was paying only minor attention to it. >I< on the
other hand, cracked him up.)

Oh...we don't restrict stuff either. I do share my opinions and ask
questions. ANd when Julian was little I used to sing "Barney is a dinosaur who feeds on
little children..." which cracked HIM up, and made him want to watch it more,
so that I would sing it....

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
